problem_text:
a) Let k be a (commutative) field. Find all irreducible subgroups G of GLn(k) having the property that G ∩ C ̸= ∅ for every conjugacy class C of GLn(k). I conjecture that G = GLn(k) except in case n = char k = 2, the field k is quadratically closed, and G is conjugate to the group of all matrices of the form
( α 0; 0 β ), ( 0 α; β 0 )
where α ̸= 0 and β ̸= 0.
P. M. Neumann
answer: a) The conjecture is refuted (S. A. Zyubin, Algebra and Logic, 45, no. 5 (2006), 296–305).
